summary:
American Samoa is a U.S. territory in the South Pacific, near the country of Samoa. It includes several volcanic islands and a coral atoll. The capital is Pago Pago, located on Tutuila, the largest island. With a population of around 47,400, most residents are Samoans who speak English and Samoan.

The U.S. took control in the 19th century, and it became a strategic naval base. American Samoa gained self-governance in 1967 but remains under U.S. administration. It has a tropical climate and a thriving tuna fishing industry. The military has a big presence, and many locals join the army. Tourism is growing but needs development. American Samoa faces challenges with poverty and people moving away.
title: American Samoa
